feed.title: Hello there - showcase
feed.subtitle: I’m ```Aditya Deshlahre``` — I tinker with Linux, open source, AI, and code in TypeScript & Go. I focus on backend work, infra, deployments, and designing reliable systems.

entry.title: Got Selected For GSoC 2025
entry.content:
GSoC'2025

So this year 2025, I applied to the organization The OpenELIS Global Foundation for the second time. Later on got disclosed with the project in November 2024 which was a good point where anyone can start contributing and beat me with their skills!

This time our organization is coming up with 7 projects this year. One of them is Rewrite Test Management & Components JSP to ReactJS. This time I was already familiar with the codebase and quite confident in my work.

So submitting a proposal was a must, hence after continuous contributions over 1.2 years, I submitted a proposal and there was less competition this time also because even though the project was disclosed too early.

On Date: 2025-05-01 at 18:00 UTC & 23:10 IST there was mail in my inbox of getting selected in Google Summer of Code 2025 for the second time.

Thank You!

entry.title: Phase 02 Completed of GSoC 2024
entry.content:
Phase 02 GSoC'2024 completion >>>>>>>>>>

So from week one of GSoC [May 01 > August 25] I came so far slowly and gradually building Admin Pages and Components one by one. I have completed the whole project Admin Routes under the time limit which I presented to my mentors and they were happy with the work.

Initially the project seemed heavy but after understanding the codebase it's been going with the flow.

I have 2-3 weeks left so I eventually started working on different Test Management related pages and ended up making 2-3 more pages out of my project.

Eventually This is how my GSoC 2024 was Under Organization OpenELIS Global.

check out my work here

Thank You!

entry.title: Phase 01 Completed of GSoC 2024
entry.content:
Phase 01 GSoC'2024 >>>>>>>>>>

So unlike other contributors, I was going through Community Bonding Phase [date: 1 May > 27 May] where mostly contributors communicate more about their project to their project admin. I also did the same things, talked to my mentor Mr Cliff Gita. We have set up weekly meetings on Friday (eventually it didn't work out) so every week I present my work and updates to my mentors and similar things I do in THU's community meetings too.

Biggest support in the whole PHASE 01 on contributions was from Mr Moses Mutesasira in every take. He supported us in debugging and making things clear as well. Eventually he started giving extra time to community calls. Hence that was very helpful for faster development :)

Also whenever I have some specific doubts we connect on SLACK HUDDLES for faster development and debugging and fixes!

All i wanted to say till now i had a best experience in OPENELIS foundation and working here toooo.....

:::::::::::: Some Serious things ::::::::::::

To see my week by week updates you can follow up here : Main Thread This will take you to our forum where we talk some serious stuff.

To directly reach my PRs : Click Here It will take you GITHUB and hence you can check my work!

Thank You!

entry.title: Got Selected For GSoC 2024
entry.content:
GSoC'2024

So this year 2024, I started contributing to an organization called The OpenELIS Global Foundation in January. Later on got to know this organization will be coming up in GSoC this year. After knowing this, I got super pumped and started contributing very aggressively.

This organization is coming up with 6 projects this year. One of them is Rewrite Admin Pages & Components JSP to ReactJS. I was already familiar with ReactJS and quite confident on it.

So submitting a proposal was a must, hence after aggressive contributing in the time frame of JAN-APRIL months, I submitted a proposal and there was less competition because this organization is coming for the first time in GSoC.

On Date: 2024-05-01 at 18:00 UTC & 22:00 IST there was mail in my inbox of getting selected in Google Summer of Code 2024.

And knowingly this is a 20th Year of GSoC happening

Thank You!

entry.title: GPU Passthrough
entry.content:
GPU Passthrough [qemu-kvm-vifo-pci]

[An unsuccessful attempt]

Example/Explanation Demo Video here!

This video is so amazing, once you watch it you will love how seamlessly you can switch between Linux to Windows VM. Which is passed through your GPU output and getting displayed on the monitor and running parallel via a single setup!

I tried to do the same thing with my laptop which is [Acer-Aspire-07-5500U-1650gtxGPU]!

As a tech nerd I did all the research: YouTube, documentation, vfio, PCI outputs and everything.

I moved towards the configuring my laptop and found out that my HDMI output is connected to my AMD-i-gpu not the dedicated 1650-d-gtx-GPU.

Suddenly I started hating my laptop choice but later on I got to know about Single-GPU passthrough but this time.

I Found out that Internal-GPUs are not capable of it.

The video/point I got jealous at is here!

Take Aways

  • don't Know
  • just learn stuff

Later on I left researching about thing and thought of building my own PC! But this is another pain in the butt so watched some videos and realized this will cost money so left research here...

WOW so much time i wasted........! dammmm bro NOT on research BUT on watching videos.

and this is An unsuccessful attempt of GPU passthrough.

Thank You!

entry.title: JavaScript Topics I MISSED
entry.content:
JavaScript Topics [ MUST LEARN ]

I ignored this TOPICS which are extremely important before diving to REACT !

  • Arrays
  • Arrow Functions
  • Objects
  • Maps [HighOnWork]
  • Filtering
  • Destructuring
  • Mutability/Immutability

Not javascript specific but yes must do this!

  • Reconciliation [MOST-IMPORTANT]
